page.title: 04THE PUNCHBOWL INN
page.content: The original Punchbowl was built in 1240 at the same time as the church. The{Lean}family owned the pub for 200 years.They have the original punchbowl (a large dish),which holds a drink called punch.The cellar used to be a blacksmith's shop.A long time ago the kitchen used to be a{Court}and they probably took the people to the church to the stocks for punishment.In the 18th and 19th centuries coaches brought people to the pub to wait for the ships to come into Fowey.One day a vicar fell down the stairs and died.His ghost became a cockerel and haunted the visitors.One day he was seen flying into the clome oven.The door was shut and cemented up,never to be opened again.
